intro: Anchusa variegata, commonly known as the variegated blueweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils, often found in rocky or dry habitats. It is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators. Anchusa variegata is also used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
